fields.description:
If a project attempts to build without a builder is seems that a series of things go wrong (see http://keg:8080/bamboo/viewBuildResults.action?buildNumber=497&projectKey=JIRA)

* Two build summaries gets added to the project
* Sometime the project build results are not added to the project, causing the build results page to fail catastrophically

We should perhaps validate the project before each build
fields.summary: Bad things happen when Builders disappear

fields.description:
When a new project is created when build queues are disabled, the project sits there constantly polling the (CVS) server. When you view the project details (by clicking edit project), the setting is set to polling even though you may of set it to build only when triggered. If you then enable the queues and the build goes through, the setting is corrected.

When a build is kicked off from an existing project when the build is triggered, the build is 'queued' even though there are no build queues (i.e. when the build queues are enabled, the build then starts). Additionally, the 'queued' project also sits there constantly polling the server every second.
fields.summary: Constant polling with queues disabled

fields.description:
profile pages don't exist yet.

link needs to be removed or profile pages created before release
fields.summary: Missing profile

fields.description:
In the pointers page (viewable only when there are no projects) there are links to Ant, Maven or Command line that doesn't exist.

These need to be created or the links deleted.
fields.summary: Missing pages

fields.description:
remove projects from a build queue may lead to unpredictable behaviour

1. bamboo stil thinks builds have gone though (adds to build count and build results)
2. after 1. other behaviour such as 500 errors (e.g. freemarker.core.InvalidReferenceException: Expression buildResults.failedTestResults is undefined on line 75, column 15 in viewBuildResults.ftl.) when accessing the build results of the build that was stopped
fields.summary: deleting projects from queue

fields.description:
build queues beyond the first one are non functional

projects are never built

easily reproducable

JettyAcceptanceBugTestHarness will demonstrate (BuildQueueBugTest)
fields.summary: build queues nonfunctional

fields.description: Just need to put in a freemarker test
fields.summary: View project files page blows up when therte is no files
Added Permission Controls to Bamboo

fields.description:
Some dodginess surrounding the showing and hiding of fields.

The test results directory radio buttons shouldn't be shown unless the checkbox indicating there are tests is ticked.
The custom results directory text field shouldn't be shown unless the user selects teh radio button indicating they want to specify their own test directory.

This should be part of the rewrite of the code.
fields.summary: Hiding/showing of fields (build settings when creating a project)

fields.description: When you edit a build queue, the text where the build queue name is becomes a text field with the build queue name in it. However, the text field reserved for the name of a new build queue is also set to the name of the build queue that is being edited.
fields.summary: Editing build queues sets 2 text fields

fields.description:
Names can be duplicated
Names can be blank
fields.summary: Validation when adding build queues needed

fields.description: Project keys and names are not checked when you clone a project. This allows the duplication of project names and keys, and other stuff that shouldn't happen such as blank project names.
fields.summary: Validation when Cloning projects

fields.description: When cloning a project with the change detection set to "detect" (i.e. Ctrigger, Strigger), this field is reset.
fields.summary: Cloning projects & the changeDetection field

fields.description:
When creating a build from a SVN repository, the project successfully checks out & builds a project when only a login name is provided (i.e. a password is not required).

Caching bug?
fields.summary: SVN password not required

fields.description:
When editing a project, there is 4 screens. Changes made wont be saved unless you hit the submit button at the bottom of each page. All changes made will be discarded if you fail to goto the 4th screen and hit 'save' there as well.

Pretty counter intuitive --> maybe a save button on each page? Maybe that's not enough.
fields.summary: saving the project during editing

fields.description:
during setup ${bambooHome} created in the wrong directory

it is instead created in the working directory when the -Dbamboo.home is not the working directory.
fields.summary: ${bambooHome} directory misplacement?

fields.description:
Phantom project folders (with the same names as the project key) are being created when you create the project.

These project folders are created in the working directory (with VM param -Dbamboo.home set to another folder [other than .])
fields.summary: Phantom project folders created when creating a new project/build

fields.description:
Standard results are defined as
**/surefire-reports/*.xml

However, results should take into account the standard working directory defined in the project such that it will not grab the results from other sub directories.
fields.summary: Standard results directory does not take into account the working subdirectory (maven2)

fields.description:
The list of failed tests amd successful tests are incorrectly reported.

It seems as if only one list is kept for all successful tests in every file (i.e. one file regardless of the number of test files) and one list for all failures.

Bamboo is supposed to report the successful and failed tests in each file, however, for each file, it seems to start reading from the beginning of the list again such that it reports successes and failures for tests not in the corresponding test file.

The aggregation of numbers are out of whack too.

The build logs however, are correct.
fields.summary: Incorrect reporting of Test Results

fields.description:
Directories in Project Build Files of a project gives a 500 error. Raised by
"InvalidReferenceException: Expression velocityCount is undefined on line 20, column 18 in viewProjectFiles.ftl."
In 'viewProjectFiles.ftl' there exists a legacy 'velocityCount' which (presumedly) exists from the previous vm file.
fields.summary: Browsing directories in project build files gives 500 error

fields.description:
Deleting the project while building causes 500 error

Server logs "Expression build.project is undefined on line 32, column 90 in fragments/showBuildQueue.ftl."

Project performs a CVS update instead of a checkout as files are found in the local project  directory.
fields.summary: Deleting Project while Checking Out causes 500 error
Allows CVS repo to timeout and report on locking issues

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a global log or timeline feature. This should cover all tools which Bamboo integrates with either out of the box or via configuration. Something similar is seen in Edgewall's Trac tool as noted here:

      http://trac.edgewall.org/timeline

Something like this could also be built into JIRA or Confluence.

B
fields.summary: Create integrated global log/timeline

fields.description: + all the user management stuff that goes with it
fields.summary: Add atlassian-user to Bamboo

fields.description: It seems that downloading a build artifact actually forces bamboo to read the file into memory before streaming it back to the user. This causes OutOfMemory exceptions quite quickly
fields.summary: Build artifacts gobble up memory

fields.description:
As part of our release process, we update and tag a particular version of Confluence in CVS. Bamboo may or may not build this exact version, depending on what other commits occur around the same time. After tagging, we check out the tag locally and build and run the tests to make sure our tagged version is okay to release or deploy. As a build server, Bamboo should be able to do this.

To run a "release build" or "tagged build", the user would select a project, select a VCS branch and tag, and Bamboo would run the normal build process and capture artifacts, etc.

Bamboo should keep a list of "release builds" or "tagged builds" separate to the normal list of builds, since the normal list of builds has a useful chronological order which release builds would disrupt.

As a secondary enhancement, the release builds should be configurable separately to the normal builds. That is, they could configured to run different maven targets (including deployment, perhaps), and capture different artifacts (JAR and WAR files, for example).
fields.summary: Build nominated versions of projects

fields.description:
On the comment in the code changes tab, do a str.replace("(\\n|\\r\\n)", "
$1").
fields.summary: Code changes comment should replace newlines with

fields.description:
when viewing an error result in the log viewer, the spaces are not preserved, so you cannot visually determine the location of the error: 

/opt/bamboo/xml-data/build-dir/INV/invoice-tools/src/java/com/atlassian/invoice/parser/CurrencyParser.java:22: warning: unmappable character for encoding UTF8
protected static final String VALID_CURRENCY_SYMBOLS = "[\\(\\$��]";
^

(side note: the symbols are not preserved, don't know whether they are in the actual log file or not, but it would be great if it preserved the charset)
fields.summary: Log Viewer and Build Error Results should preserve whitespace formatting

fields.description: Should add a bootstrapping process much like Confluence to make installation more user friendly
fields.summary: Bootstrapping process

fields.description:
One idea: once users and groups are in Bamboo, make project notification just specify which groups and/or users to notify. Each user can then decide how she wishes to be notified. 

For example, project Confluence could notify: confluence-developers, jonathon@atlassian.com Each user would have a preference about whether they should be notified via Jabber, email or both.

There are many other possible solutions. I think we need a balance between administrator-configured notification (a la JIRA) and user-configured notification (a la Confluence). There are benefits to both.
fields.summary: Improve configuration of notifications

fields.description:
For example, between Confluence Stable build 169 and 170, I added a test. It would be good to see on the build summary page the names of the tests that were added.

Maybe as another section at the top of the test results?

Alternatively, give the option to sort all the tests by when they were added (by build #, I guess). That would be an interesting display for project that had been in Bamboo since inception.
fields.summary: Have a list of new tests added when the number of tests in a project increase

fields.description:
At the moment you need to edit the loginfo / commitinfo file yourself. All this information, however is available to Bamboo, so it should try to assist in writing the trigger for you.

Even if it doesn't edit the files in CVSROOT for you it should give you an easy copy & pastable line to put into your respective files
fields.summary: Generate build trigger commands

fields.description: This might have been because of the "Unknown" logs. We should monitor this to see if it appears again. Seems to cause checkin issues for people
fields.summary: There seems to be CVS locks in the Confluence project

fields.description:
This isn't quite so easy since not all repos have a modules file, Eclipse and IDEA *does* seem to manage it somehow though.

So there's really two parts to this. One is for when there is a modules file and you can go {{cvs co -c}} and another scenario where there is not.

Will need investigations for the latter I'd suspect
fields.summary: Show CVS modules drop down when selecting CVS

fields.description:
When adding repo, should check if the repo is accessible as well as module is valid etc.

Need to be done for all 3 repos
fields.summary: Improve repository validation

fields.description: We should add / extend our generic error handling framework to handle different levels of error and pass this object right down to the CVS repo level. This way we can most acccurately report errors and warnings of things returned from the CVS server as well as file conflicts
fields.summary: Better error handling with CVS repo

fields.description:
Apparently it doesn't exist in some linux distributions and will need to full path to it.

MIght be worth looking into using a replacement
fields.summary: Investigate alternative to wget in trigger scripts

fields.description: This depends to BAM-7 being completed first. Should be fairly easy after that
fields.summary: Allow renaming of projects

fields.description:
Format the project key by setting it to upper case and remove any non-alpha numeric characters.

Maybe even pre populate from name?
fields.summary: Add javascript to format the project key

fields.description:
Use Hibernate to create tables etc. 

Default to using HSQL 1.8 to start with

Test by importing Build Results
fields.summary: Setup Hibernate

fields.description: Replace custom IoC with Spring IoC container
fields.summary: Setup Spring

fields.description: For use with ConsistencyChecker and Licensing etc
fields.summary: Setup Johnson Filter

fields.description: Add i18Helper like JIRA
fields.summary: Setup i18n infrastructure

fields.description:
The activity log currently does some basic highlighting. It'd be nice if it also allows you to 

* "reverse" the log order (newest up to)
* control the number of of line display
* Setup refresh rate
fields.summary: More advanced log / activity viewer

fields.description: When editing / cloning a project, you see the previously entered password. Need an alternative way to change password. Perhaps a checkbox and text box combo
fields.summary: CVS Passwords displayed in plain text

fields.description: And auto detect the version of Ant and Maven 1 and 2. Not that useful but would be nice for people with lots of ant home & maven homes
fields.summary: Add version field to builder

fields.description: Much like ANT_HOME and MAVEN_HOME being automatically detected, we should also detect presence of Bash
fields.summary: Add Bash as a default custom command builder

fields.description: Needs to pull it from the AdminConfig
fields.summary: Help path in builder validation is hard coded with localhost:8080

fields.description:
The address returns a 404:

  http://cvs.atlassian.com:8080/bamboo/images/icons/help.gif

on every page.
fields.summary: Help icon not working

fields.description:
On this page, a revision number 'unknown' is linked to fisheye:

  http://cvs.atlassian.com:8080/bamboo/viewBuildResultsChanges.action?buildNumber=17&projectName=Atlassian%20Core

Which causes a 404 when clicked.

Ideally, we just shouldn't link those versions.
fields.summary: Don't link 'Unknown' revision numbers

fields.description:
By the rule that you shouldn't show users things that they can't do - we shouldn't show the operations column when there are no available operations:

  http://cvs.atlassian.com:8080/bamboo/start.action
fields.summary: Remove operations column if the user cannot perform any operations

fields.description: It currently is http://www.atlassian.com/forums (which doesn't exist), but it should be http://forums.atlassian.com/
fields.summary: Link to forums in footer is wrong

fields.description:
There are a few things that I don't like about this page:

  http://cvs.atlassian.com:8080/bamboo/viewPreviousBuildLog.action?buildNumber=38&projectName=JIRA%20Toolkit

* Firstly, the URL says build number 38, but it refers to build number 37
* Secondly - the next, previous isn't obvious to me as to what it is.  Could we either: (a) move it closer to the part that says 'Build 37' or (b) have it just say 'Build 36' and 'Build 38', which I think is _much_ more obvious as to what it is doing?
fields.summary: Improve build number paging

fields.description:
On this page, there are arrows:

  http://cvs.atlassian.com:8080/bamboo/viewBuildResultsChanges.action?buildNumber=39&projectName=JIRA%20Toolkit

Which are so unobvious with what they do that the need an explanation.

Remove the arrows, and just link the file, and the revision themselves.

Similar to how http://cvs.atlassian.com:8181/viewrep/AtlassianCVS links the file and the revision.
fields.summary: Remove superfluous images & image links

fields.description:
I love it that you can get the time by hovering over the charts, but you really need a scale, so I can tell roughly how long the whole thing is taking.

Example chart:

  http://cvs.atlassian.com:8080/bamboo/viewProjectSummary.action?projectName=JIRA%20Toolkit
fields.summary: Charts should have a scale

fields.description:
On this page:

  http://cvs.atlassian.com:8080/bamboo/viewBuildResultsChanges.action?buildNumber=39&projectName=JIRA%20Toolkit

The 'code changes' link is still underlined, but it shouldn't be.  This seems to affect all the links from the top.

Also - the failed / successful should be changed - I don't expect to stay on the same page when I click tabs.
fields.summary: Hyperlinks not unlinked when you are on the page the refer to
Make sure data is trimmed when configuring builders

fields.description: So image links are broken
fields.summary: No baseUrl in builder's Velocity context

fields.description: There seems to be dirs with the project's name (not key) in the build directories. It seems that _something_ is causing this (nothing is in it)
fields.summary: Bamboo creating phantom directories

fields.description:
At present the change detector runs in a single Thread (pretty much just loops over each project and checks whether it needs to be checked out).

This causes the UI to look unresponsive at times. e.g. if Bamboo is checking out project Y (to see if anything has changed) and you click "Build" on another project, there is no feedback to say that the request was acknowledged.

We should look if it's possible for this to be an asynchronous triggered process or at the very least, ensure that request is acknowledged (maybe have an activity queue somewhere)
fields.summary: Investigate making change detector to run asynchronously or in a queue

fields.description:
There seems to be occasions when the project is building but does not appear on the visible queue and vise versa. Generally, the triggered builds work fine, but it's just the UI build queue that seems out of whack. Keeping two sperate lists is probably not a great idea

Need to investigate this further.

One possible solution would be to migrate existing queues to ActiveMQ queses since it (apparently) allows for queues to be _browsed_
fields.summary: Build Queue sometimes doesn't match actual project building

fields.description: Bamboo should set the content type correctlya as to allow the use of the browser's default handling of file types
fields.summary: Artifacts should respect MIME types

fields.description: The trigger is reinstatitaed and is also rerun
fields.summary: Changing Trigger type forces a new build

fields.description: At the moment the CVS trigger runs for all branches of the repository. It would ideally run only for the selected branch
fields.summary: CVS Trigger for Branches

fields.description: The project list on the dashboard should be embeddable in any external applications so one can easily write a HTML page, Confluence macro or JIRA portlet to display it

fields.description: In mail you can configure to only receive messages on failures. This should also be possible for the jabber messages
fields.summary: Add abillity to configure Jabber messages like the mail

fields.description: You should be able to arbitarily sort the projects on the dashboard. Your orderingselection should also be remembered as a cookie.
fields.summary: Sorting Projects on the Dashboard
RSS feed title and author is 'Beetlejuice'

fields.description:
If you have permission to see the logs of previous builds, you should also be able to see the results of currently running builds.

This doesn't seem to be the case.
fields.summary: Build log should be visible to anonymous users on dashboard

fields.description: Build history should default to the last 25 builds as opposed to just today's build
fields.summary: Build history should default to the last 25 builds

fields.description: Looks like when the Reason for the build has a lot of committers - it has a nowrap and extends the table too far.
fields.summary: No wrap on reason field

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new project
2. On the second setting page, specifiy a test directory.
3. Save the project.
4. Edit the newly created project, go to page 2.

The specified test directory is no longer visible. This occurs both for creating new projects and editing existing ones.

We need this functionality to run the Confluence acceptance tests in Bamboo.
fields.summary: On settings page 'Building the Project', the specify test directory option isn't saved

fields.description:
In the Confluence builds, the ViewCVS urls are broken because they don't include the 'confluence' ViewCVS module.

For example, in Confluence Stable build 65, given the settings:

ViewCVS URL: http://resches.sydney.atlassian.com:8181/viewrep/AtlassianCVS/
ViewCVS module: confluence

and the changed file:

confluence/src/java/com/atlassian/confluence/upgrade/RebuildIndexUpgradeTask.java

the link to FishEye should be:

http://resches.sydney.atlassian.com:8181/viewrep/AtlassianCVS/confluence/confluence/src/java/com/atlassian/confluence/upgrade/RebuildIndexUpgradeTask.java?rev=1.3.2.2&content-type=text/vnd.viewcvs-markup&cvsroot=confluence

But it currently is:

http://resches.sydney.atlassian.com:8181/viewrep/AtlassianCVS/confluence/src/java/com/atlassian/confluence/upgrade/RebuildIndexUpgradeTask.java?rev=1.3.2.2&content-type=text/vnd.viewcvs-markup&cvsroot=confluence
fields.summary: Build setting 'ViewCVS repository module' is ignored

fields.description:
It _will_ cause problems once you have projects with internationalised names, on some platforms/browsers/app servers. 

We have many support cases in Confluence because international URLs are used for attachment downloads, javascript and AJAX URLs, among other things. Most can be resolved with configuration changes (e.g. fix Tomcat URL handling, change Confluence response encoding), but it's an unnecessary problem when numeric IDs suffice.

Bamboo should use a numeric ID in all URLs, form submissions, etc. where identifying the project by name isn't necessary.
fields.summary: Use project IDs instead of names in all URLs

fields.description: Although this may be obviated if we redo the entire UI, the current process where editing a page means you need to progress through the whole wizard is a very bad UI problem - I think we'll get lots of support about it.
fields.summary: Change edit project details from one wizard into a series of forms
Remove link to 'log in' on start page if you are already logged in

fields.description:
Confluence stable build 47 was triggered by an update, but there have been no changes to CVS.

All tests passed in the build log, but it was still marked as a failure. Note: only ~300 tests ran instead of the normal ~700.

Email notification attached.
fields.summary: Unusual build: Confluence stable #47

fields.description:
http://resches.sydney.atlassian.com:8181/viewrep/AtlassianCVS/U%20confluence/confluence/src/webapp/images/icons/profilepics/default.png?rev=Unknown&content-type=text/vnd.viewcvs-markup&cvsroot=confluence

The 'U%20' above needs to be removed.

Build 38 was caused by the following changes:

http://keg:8080/bamboo/viewBuildResultsChanges.action?buildNumber=38&projectName=Confluence

Attached mail says the following:

-- 

The build has 3 failed tests and 859 successful tests.

Click http://keg:8080/beetlejuice/viewBuildResults.action?buildNumber=33&projectName=Confluence to find out more.

-- 

Application context path should be 'bamboo', not 'beetlejuice'.

fields.description:
As a user I would like to have an option to have even shorter notifications on slack.

The current Truncated mode still sends too much information to our slack channel, we would like to have a mode with only the transition information.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to have an option to have even shorter notifications on slack

fields.description:
Currently, when I want to create a new ticket, I have to fill all content in the ticket creation page. So I just suggest to create a template for some common part.

For example, if I want to create a ticket to report a bug, I can import a bug template which is filled with some template values, like the type, the project name and even for the description, the template provide the basical description format which contains "Repro Steps", "Account", "Expected Behavior" , "Actual Behavior" etc.

And as a creator, I can just to fill the mandatory data to create a new ticket which will be much convinient.
fields.summary: Allow user to create a new ticket via template

fields.description:
Please move this ticket to ACCESS project as I don't have the ability to create it there.

 

When configuring a SAML connection in Atlassian Access we would like the ability to have users auto assigned to groups based on SAML SSO response.
fields.summary: Allow users to be assigned to groups automatically based on authorization information provided in SAML SSO response.

fields.description: Why don't Jira has the simple workflow just like other project management applications in the market?  I mean the simple Kanban board that can be created like other project management software app and then right from Kanban board can create child issues and select choices also available instead of going through workflow and create the workflow.
fields.summary: Kanban Board

fields.description:
I have recently come across some negative reports against GnuPG. ie GPG.

[https://latacora.micro.blog/2019/07/16/the-pgp-problem.html]

The GPG project is claimed to be not very secure, and is also not easy to use. Also there are a number of other tools that are claimed to be more secure than GPG too.

 

However there is a new project that aims to be the next generation security and be more superior than GPG.

[https://sequoia-pgp.org/]

It may be worthwhile for Bitbucket to officially support Sequoia PGP (or equivalent) as the project matures.
fields.summary: Sequoia PGP instead of GPG

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Bitbucket Cloud - Slack integration offers the option to *Nudge reviewers* of a Pull Request.
Selecting that option will send a Slack message to PR reviewers reminding them to review the PR.

However, it will also nudge/send a message to the user who clicked that option, which is redundant and it can also be bothersome for the user.
h3. Suggested Solution

The solution could be to
 - either not nudge at all the user who clicked that option
 - or allow users/admins to configure whether they will be nudged if they click this option
fields.summary: When "Nudge Reviewers" is clicked, do not nudge the user who clicked that option

fields.description:
While exporting the Insight object field using Excel, it shows '[no field found]'.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability to export Insight field value using Excel export.
h3. Workaround

As a workaround, you can use [automation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/automate-your-objects-in-insight/] to copy the value of an Insight field to a Jira text field. Please check the section *Edit Issue* in [this|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/automation-actions/#Automationactions-Editissue] link which may help.
fields.summary: Add the ability to export Insight object field using Excel

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using a copied spreadsheet connected to Jira using Jira Cloud for Excel produces a change in the original spreadsheet when the filter is changed. The original spreadsheet timestamp is kept.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Spreadsheet in Excel and using the Excel integration perform a JQL query in Jira. (i.e. *project = TEST*)
 # Save the Spreadsheet and copy it.
# Change the query in the copied spreadsheet (i.e. *project = TEST2*).
# Opening the original spreadsheet shows the query *project = TEST2*. The data is updated if the Re-run my query each time I open workbook option is selected. The timestamp of the file is kept. 

h3. Expected Results
The original spreadsheet should show the query *project = TEST*
h3. Actual Results
The original spreadsheet shows the query *project = TEST2*
Also, the original spreadsheet is keeping its timestamp.

h3. Workaround
By now the only workaround is not to use copied spreadsheets.
fields.summary: Using a copied spreadsheet in Jira Cloud for Excel produces change in the original spreadsheet.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

I want to be able to see and edit more fields on the "Issues list" view. Ideally, I'd like to customize the view.

The question was asked here [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Management/Can-i-customise-the-available-fields-in-the-outlook-plug-in/qaq-p/1872872]
fields.summary: Customize fields in "Issues list" of Jira Cloud ofr Outlook add-in

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Exporting issues using the 'Open in Microsoft Excel' feature does not export Team-managed custom fields values.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Search for issues from team-managed projects that have custom fields created and populated.
 # Export the issues using the 'Open in Microsoft Excel' feature.
 # Custom fields from the Team-managed project will be empty and lack data.

h3. Expected Results
Excel file should contain Team-managed custom field data.
h3. Actual Results
Excel file does not contain Team-managed custom field data.

h3. Workaround

Export issues using *Export Excel CSV (All fields)/(Current field)* feature.
fields.summary: Exporting issues using 'Open in Microsoft Excel' feature does not export Team-managed custom fields values

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using MS teams to create issues the integration does not load the issue types/creation form if the project issue type has cascade custom fields required included in the screen/field configuration.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a cascade custom field
 # Add it to the creation screen from an issue type
 # In the field configurations make it required
 # In MS teams try to create an issue from that issue type
[Video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/P8u8z51D]

h3. Expected Results

The MS teams integration should list all available issue types
h3. Actual Results

The issue type list does not return values
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
The only fix is removing the cascade field from the screen configuration or making the field optional
fields.summary: MS teams: create form is not loaded if there is a cascade custom field required

fields.description: There's a benefit in being able to backtrack changes and understand which changes were made and the actors.
fields.summary: Log history of configuration changes for Slack for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the Jira Cloud for Slack application, there's no possibility to create a ticket on behalf of other JSM customers.

h3. Expected Results
It would be nice to have the option to create a ticket on behalf of other customers.

h3. workaround
Open a ticket through the portal or change the reporter after issue creation.
fields.summary: Ability to create ticket on behalf of Service Management Customer (Jira for Slack app)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, you must click on the 3 dots in a message to create tickets.

h3. Expected Results
Would be nice to have this setting to allow users to create tickets easely.
fields.summary: Linking a specific Slack channel and Jira to automatically create tickets when certain buttons are clicked

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you have multiple versions assigned to an issue and remove or add and remove one of them, the Microsoft Teams notification from the Jira Cloud bot will display it as if there was none. The same does not apply to a multiple choices field.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Watch an issue
 # Add multiple Fix Versions to it
 # Remove one of them
 # Check the MS Teams notification

!fix-version-update.gif|width=964,height=662!
h3. Expected Results

A notification containing a list of all versions before and after the update (e.g., v1, v2 --> v1, v3).
h3. Actual Results

A notification containing only the removed value to none, even when another version was added in the same update (e.g., v2 --> None).
h3. Workaround

Currently, there's none.
fields.summary: Misleading notifications from Jira Cloud for MS Teams

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using a JQL query which contains values for statusCategory field in a MS Teams Channel, the following error message is shown:
{code:java}
'in progress' value doesn't exist for 'statuscategory' field{code}
Example of query:
{code:java}
project = TEST AND statusCategory in ("To Do", "In Progress"){code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Jira Filters
 # Create a new Filter using a query similar to _project = TEST AND statusCategory in ("To Do", "In Progress")_
 # Set the filter access to Organization
 # Go to a MS Teams Channel and add a new Jira Cloud Tab
 # Select the filter created on step 2

h3. Expected Results

The filter in MS Team Channel should return all the issues that are returned when using the same filter in Jira.
h3. Actual Results

An error message is shown saying that given values don't exist for 'statuscategory' field.

h3. Workaround

If the goal is to return all issues which are not in Done status category and if Resolution field is used, the following query might return the same results:

{code}project = TEST AND resolution = NULL ORDER BY created DESC {code}
fields.summary: Not possible to use statusCategory in a JQL filter query in a MS Teams Channel

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to see the text formatting options in the Description field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- From Outlook Desktop Application not able to view the text formatting options in the Description field.

- Another user on the same Outlook version is able to see all the formatting options in the Description field.

- The affected user is able to see all the formatting options when using the Outlook Web Application.

h3. Expected Results

Should be able to see all the text formatting options from the Outlook Desktop Application 

h3. Actual Results

Not able to see all the text formatting options from the Outlook Desktop Application 



h3. Workaround

The affected user can see all the text formatting options using the Outlook Web Application.
fields.summary: Desktop Outlook application has issues with the text formatting in the Description field

fields.description:
Hi,

I have added the Slack apps for Jira and Confluence but the notifications are quite intrusive. For any update I get a mention which alerts me:

!image-2021-11-09-09-04-35-468.png!

Could you please change this to a regular notification? Or even better let me chose which kind of notifications I would like depending on the message type.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Less intrusive notifications in the Slack app

fields.description:
h3. Current behavior

It is only possible to create tickets by navigating to existing emails.
h3. Desired behavior

Allow the possibility to create new tickets without the need to navigate to emails. The ticket will not have any link to any previous emails. E.g. a *Create Jira Issue* button.
h3. Workaround

Select an email to create a ticket but do not select the *Include Email Content* checkbox when submitting the request.
fields.summary: Create tickets from Outlook without needing to navigate to emails

fields.description:
h3. Context
Currently, the app has a regular expression that will convert any matching text into a Jira ticket. In some cases, a company that uses a similar pattern for purchase orders and so on, which causes confusion.

h3. Current behaviour
Any value that matches a "key-numbers" e.g. PO-12345 will be parsed as a Jira issue.

h3. Desired behaviour
Allow customers to set an exclusion list of project keys - e.g. any match that starts with "PO" won't be treated as a Jira issue.
fields.summary: Enable exclusion keys in "Jira Cloud for Outlook" Add-In
